summary: This document appears to be a court filing or investigative summary outlining the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors. It references the 2008 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) that immunized Epstein and alleged co-conspirators, and states that investigators are now identifying New York-based victims and reviewing complaints post-dating the NPA.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation for sexually abusing dozens of minors over more than a decade.

events.title: Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein resolved a pending federal investigation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida with a Non-Prosecution Agreement (Florida NPA).

keyFacts: The investigation alleges Jeffrey Epstein sexually abused dozens of minors over a decade or more, including minors transported to/from New York.
A 2008 Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) immunized Epstein and alleged co-conspirators, including a New York-based 'booker'.
Investigators are reviewing documents from the original investigation and identifying New York-based victims.
The investigation plans to look into complaints and allegations of potential misconduct that occurred after the 2008 Florida NPA.
